intro: Syngonanthus caulescens var. douradensis, commonly known as the Douradense spurge, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, branched stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers surrounded by green bracts, which are typical of the genus Syngonanthus. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in shaded, moist environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it may be invasive in certain regions.
